abstract: A lawsuit is reigniting an issue that roiled Congress after the government’s bailout of Wall Street: the use of valuable deductions known as net operating losses.
snippet: A lawsuit is reigniting an issue that roiled Congress after the government’s bailout of Wall Street: the use of valuable deductions known as net operating losses.
lead_paragraph: An economics professor has filed a lawsuit against Citigroup accusing the bank of using an unusual federal tax break during the financial crisis to avoid paying $800 million in New York State taxes.

headline.main: Citigroup Accused of Improperly Avoiding $800 Million in New York State Taxes
headline.print_headline: Citigroup Accused of Skirting State Taxes
